intro: Ocymastrum trinerve, commonly known as the three-veined ocymastrum, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and branched stems. The leaves are typically lance-shaped with a prominent central vein, giving it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish or reddish in color. This plant is often found in sandy or disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
